body_html:
1. I7 cores are faster than Xeon cores. My 4 year old macbook outperforms brand new Xeon V3s on single-core stuff
  2. Your network is tiny, so it's hard to use more than one core
  3. Increasing number intra_op_parallelism_threads above 1 can hurt performance for small work-loads. I've recently dealt with a network where setting all parallelism to 1 gave a 50% speed-up in average time.

Therefore I think this is WAI

Therefore I think this is WAI
body:
1. I7 cores are faster than Xeon cores. My 4 year old macbook outperforms brand new Xeon V3s on single-core stuff
2. Your network is tiny, so it's hard to use more than one core
3. Increasing number `intra_op_parallelism_threads` above 1 can hurt performance for small work-loads. I've recently dealt with a network where setting all parallelism to 1 gave a 50% speed-up in average time.

Therefore I think this is WAI
